result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:03 AM Judge Annette Barna appears by video from Rusk County.  Defendant Norman Joseph Price appears by video from Mendota Health Institute. Attorney Jon Padgham appeared by video for Norman Joseph Price.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Continues to track with cases listed above. Adjourned until further notice.
Minutes from 08/29/22 AMENDED - Court did grant stay.

Motion Hearings for 20CF10 / 20CF197 / 20CF350 / 20CM11 / 20CM61 / 20CM138 / 20CM139 / 20CM199 / 21CF378 / 22CF122
 - 21CF378 & 22CF158 Tracking

9:32 AM Judge Annette Barna appears by video from Rusk County. Defendant Norman Joseph Price appears by video from Mendota Health Institute..   Attorney Jon Padgham appeared by video for Norman Joseph Price.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews court record on the motions of medication. State responds to the reason of motions. Judge Barna experiencing technical difficulties but states to continue as audio is working. State calls witness, Dr. Andressa Medrado Dias Silveir.  9:40AM Clerk swears in Dr. Medrado. Testifies direct. 9:43 AM 20CF10 - State admits the report. Atty Padgham has no objection to this report. Court grants the evidence. State continues questioning. 10:00 AM State has no further questions. Cross examination. 10:03 AM No further questions from either party. Witness is excused by the court. State asks Court to take judicial notice on the charges in the pending cases. State makes argument. Atty Padgham makes argument on other options for DEF. Court takes judicial notice as requested by the State. Padgham has no objections. Court makes statements. Court will find the DEF to be incompetent to proceed with the case and orders involuntary medications due to testimony and prior records. Court states the medication will likely render the DEF to become competent within the statutory time frame. DEF speaks to the Court. Court responds to the DEF. Atty Padgham states that the DEF wishes to stay the medication order to file an appeal. State opposes the stay and refers to 22 Wisconsin 30. Court will grant the request for stay at this time and wishes to review case law. Court advises Atty Padgham to file the paperwork. After review of case law, Court will provide an order. Court adjourns.
Motion hearing on August 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
NASJ returned from 12827 W Neezh Street Hayward WI 54843

3:02PM Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County. Defendant Norman Joseph Price appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail, with Attorney Jon Padgham appearing in person.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette appearing in person for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case (20CM139, 21CF378, 20CF350, 20CM199, 20CF197, 20CF10, 20CM138, 20CM11, 20CM61, 19CM231, 22CF122)  and recites appearances.  Case is tracking with all other cases listed.

9:31 AM Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County.  Defendant Norman Joseph Price appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail. Attorney Jon Padgham appeared by video for Norman Joseph Price. Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl in court appearing by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case (21CF378, 22CF122, 20CM139, 20CM199, 20CF10, 20CF350, 20CM11, 20CM138, 20CF197, 20CM61, 19CM231) and recites appearances. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, Atty Padgham acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint for 22CF122.  Atty Padgham makes statement, requesting to adjourn setting prelim until he is able to meet with DEF.  Court questions parties on status of competency evaluation.  State indicates competency evaluation has been filed.  Court verifies competency evaluation report has been filed, indicates competency hearing should be set, allowing time for Atty Padgham to speak with DEF.  Court sets comp. hearing for 5/27/22 at 3pm.  Atty Padgham indicates DEF would like a bond reduction motion hearing.  Court agrees to hear motion at this time.  Atty Padgham requests bond modification/reduction.  State objects to bond modification.  Court is satisfied that current bond is appropriate, Court denies bond modification motion.  State questions if competency examiner is able to appear by zoom.  Atty Padgham has no objection.  Court indicates examiner is able to appear by zoom for competency hearing.  DEF makes statement on bond.  Court informs DEF to speak with his attorney.  

9:43AM Court is adjourned.
Competency hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:03 AM Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County.  Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with Attorney Jon Padgham appearing by video.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Padgham acknowledges receipt of complaint and DEF understands charges and penalties.  Atty Padgham indicates recently appointed, requests adjournment to allow time to discuss all current cases with DEF.  State has no objection.  Court indicates DEF is holding up documents to screen.  Court addresses DEF, informing him case will be adjourned.  DEF makes several incoherent statements.  Atty Padgham addresses DEF, DEF responds.  Court sets Adjourned INIT for 5/19/22 at 9:30AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
